sources.title: Spirits of the Dead (1968)
sources.description: Spirits of the Dead is a 1968 horror anthology film comprising three segments respectively directed by Roger Vadim, Louis Malle and Federico Fellini, based on stories by Edgar Allan Poe.  The first segment, "Metzengerstein," follows Countess Frédérique, who becomes obsessed with her cousin, leading to tragic consequences. The second, "William Wilson," tells the tale of a man haunted by his doppelgänger, culminating in his own destruction. The final segment, "Toby Dammit," depicts a disillusioned actor spiraling into madness as he confronts his own demons. Each story explores themes of obsession, guilt, and the darker aspects of human nature.

metadata.Plot: Three directors each adapt a Poe short story to the screen: "Toby Dammit" features a disheveled, drugged and drunk English movie star who nods acceptance in the Italian press and his producers fawn over him. "Metzengerstein" features a medieval countess who has a love-hate relationship with a black stallion - who, it turns out, is really her dead lover. "William Wilson" tells the story of a sadistic Austrian student with an exact double whom he later kills.
metadata.Director: Federico Fellini, Louis Malle, Roger Vadim
metadata.Writer: Edgar Allan Poe, Roger Vadim, Pascal Cousin
metadata.Actors: Jane Fonda, Brigitte Bardot, Alain Delon
